sen.j: 七歩蛇（しちほだ、しちふじゃ）は日本に伝わる妖怪。
sen.e: Shichihoda or Shichifuja is a Japanese specter.
A Shichihoda which is also called Shichifuja is a Japanese yokai (ghosts, spirits and monsters).

sen.j: 浅井了意の怪異小説集『伽婢子』の中で、京都東山区に出現したとされる奇怪なヘビの一種。
sen.e: It is a kind of the strange snake which have appeared in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City according to "Otogiboko," a collection of specter novels, by Ryoi ASAI.

It is a type of mysterious snakes, which is introduced in Ryoi ASAI's collected ghost stories, "Otogi-boko" (literally, a doll-shaped talisman for children, which was a stuffed doll wrapped in silk clothes and used as effigies to rid the child of misfortune and disease), in which the Shichihoda had reportedly appeared in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 体長4寸（約12センチメートル）ほどの小さい蛇。
sen.e: It is a snake and approximately 12 centimeters in length.

sen.j: だが、姿形は龍そっくりで、4本の足がある。
sen.e: However, it has four legs, and it looks just like a dragon.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, it looks just like a dragon, having four legs.

sen.j: 色は真っ赤で鱗の間が金色に光り、耳は立っている。
sen.e: Its color is crimson, it shines golden among the scales, and it has pricked ears.
The color of its body is crimson, and the gaps between the scales glittering golden, and its ears standing up.

sen.j: この蛇に噛まれた者は、その猛毒により7歩歩かぬ内に死んでしまうので、「七歩蛇」という名前がつけられたという。
sen.e: It was allegedly named "Shichihoda" (seven-step snake) because those who were bit by the snake may die within seven steps by its deadly poison.
Those who were bitten by this highly venomous, deadly snake may die within seven steps, thereby being named "Shichiho-da" (seven-step snake).

sen.j: 東山西の麓にある浦井という屋敷で、何匹もの奇怪な蛇が出現したのを退治したところ、ある日庭の木々が次々に枯れて倒れたとされる。
sen.e: It is said that after many strange snakes were eradicated at a residence called Urai at the western foot of the Higashiyama, the garden trees withered one after another and fell, and garden stones shattered to pieces.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It is said that after many mysterious snakes were found and extirpated at a residence of the Urai family at the western foot of Mount Higashi-yama, the garden trees withered one after another and fell.

sen.j: 庭石も砕け散り、砕けた石の下からこの七歩蛇が出てきたとされる。
sen.e: Then the Shichihoda allegedly came out from under the shattered stones.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The garden stones were shattered to pieces, and from under the shattered stones emerged the Shichihoda.
